meanings.definition: To scrape or scratch a surface
meanings.sent1: She scuffed the floor while moving the heavy furniture.
meanings.sent2: The children scuffed their shoes while playing in the park.
meanings.sent3: He scuffed the table accidentally while trying to rearrange the room.
meanings.sent4: The cat scuffed the door with its claws, leaving marks behind.
meanings.sent5: The worker scuffed the wall while carrying the ladder, leaving a visible scratch.

meanings.sent1: The scuffed shoes showed signs of frequent walks in the woods.
meanings.sent2: The scuffed edges of the book indicated it was well-loved.
meanings.sent3: Her scuffed bag looked like it had been on many adventures.
meanings.sent4: The scuffed paint on the old car gave it a rustic charm.
meanings.sent5: The scuffed corners of the table revealed its age and history.

meanings.definition: To drag one's feet while walking
meanings.sent1: The tired hiker scuffed along the trail, eager to reach the campsite.
meanings.sent2: The student scuffed his feet as he walked to the front of the class to present.
meanings.sent3: She scuffed her way through the sand, leaving a trail behind her.
meanings.sent4: The dog scuffed along the sidewalk, sniffing at every corner.
meanings.sent5: The toddler scuffed happily in his new shoes, enjoying the sound it made.
